description: INSTALLATION OF NEW FLOODLIGHTS TO THE EXISTING HOCKEY PITCH (8 x 15M HIGH COLUMNS)
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
01 Rev 00,
02 Rev 00,
03 Rev 00,
04 Rev 00,
Design and Access Statement inclusive of appendices: 
Appendix A - Floodlighting Performance Report 
Appendix B - LED Floodlight Data Sheet 
Appendix C - Floodlight Column 
Appendix D - ILP Guidance Notes 
Appendix E - Hire of Academy Premises Policy

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The floodlighting hereby approved shall only be used between the hours of 18.00 to 21.30 Monday to Friday and 09.30 to 20.00 Saturday and Sundays. 

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and the occupiers of neighbouring properties and ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies DM D2 and DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Polices Plan 2014 and Policy D12.3 of the draft Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 5 - The external lighting shall be positioned and angled in accordance with the approved drawings and compliant with the Institute of Lighting Professionals Guidance Note GN01/21 - The Reduction of Obtrusive Light, to prevent any light spillage or glare beyond the site boundary. A post installation lighting assessment shall be conducted to demonstrate compliance, in particular at the residential facades, and the report submitted to the LPA for approval, within 3 months of the first use of the floodlights hereby approved. The installation shall be maintained in accordance with that scheme.

Reason: Having regard to the impact on neighbouring occupiers and to accord with Policies DMD2 and DM EP2 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy D12.3 of the draft Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 6 - Construction Times - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - An upper noise limit from AGPs of 50dB LAeq,1hr (free-field) external to residential properties and in external amenity areas shall apply when the floodlights are in use.

Reason: Having regard to the impact on neighbouring occupiers and to accord with Policies DMD2 and DM EP2 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy D12.3 of the draft Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 8 - The all-weather pitch shall not be used under floodlit conditions until full details of additional control measures to minimise noise impacts (such as use of soft backboards etc) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The additional measures shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the first use of the floodlights and retained as such in perpetuity to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.


Reason: Having regard to the impact on neighbouring occupiers and to accord with Policies DMD2 and DM EP2 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy D12.3 of the draft Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 9 - The all-weather pitch shall not be used under floodlit conditions until full details of a Noise Management Plan (NMP) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The NMP shall include any other mitigation measures, practical and organisational control measures in addition to the requirements of condition 8 and procedures for dealing with and responding to complaints together with the outcome. In the event of an official complaint to the Councils Environmental Health Team relating to the use of the pitch under floodlit conditions, the applicant must present the updated NMP to the Councils Environmental Health Team for consideration to demonstrate what reasonable measures have taken place to mitigation those concerns raised. The pitch under floodlit conditions shall be fully implemented in accordance with the approved NMP prior to the first use of the pitch under floodlights and retained as such in perpetuity to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: Having regard to the impact on neighbouring occupiers and to accord with Policies DMD2 and DM EP2 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and Policy D12.3 of the draft Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 10 - Community Use Agreement - The all-weather pitch, with floodlighting, shall be made available for community use in accordance with the Community Use Agreement, agreed on 25th May 2023 between the London Borough of Merton and the Harris Federation. The pitch shall not be used otherwise than in strict compliance with the approved agreement.

Reason: To secure well managed safe community access to the sports facility, to ensure sufficient benefit to the development of sport and to accord with Policy S5 of the London Plan 2021.

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit additional supporting information in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
   ii) The application was approved subject to an agreed extension of time.
